    Included Modules Making Modules

Fetches data set views when both UD and DW modules are in use

Source: R/formods.R
FM_fetch_dsviews.Rd

The upload data and data wrangling modules can be used together. This will take the ids for both modules and return the different views available. It will also return an "acive" view. This either the uploaded dataset if no wrangling information is available or the last wrangled view.

Usage

FM_fetch_dsviews(state, id_UD, id_DW, react_state)

Arguments

state

Current module state after yaml file has been read

id_UD

ID string for the upload data module used to handle uploads or the name of the list element in react_state where the data set is stored.

id_DW

ID string for the data wrangling module used to process any uploaded data

react_state

Variable passed to server to allow reaction outside of module (NULL)

Value

list containing the current dataset with the following format:

  • isgood: Boolean indicating the whether a dataset was found (FALSE)

  • dsviews:

    • dsv_summary: Dataframe summarizing the available views

    • contents: List containing the contents of the data views

    • columns: List containing the columns names from the contents.

    • checksum: List containing a checksum of the data view. You can use this to detect changes in that view.

  • UD_checksum: Checksum used to detect changes in the source dataset from the UD module (NULL if not found).

  • DW_checksum: Checksum used to detect changes in any of the views from the DW module (NULL if not found).

  • active: Data view key for the active data view. If no DW views were round it will just be "default". If there are DW views it will return the active DW view.

The named elements in the lists discussed in dsviews

are either "default" for the originally loaded dataset or a unique key generated by the DW module.
